issue.title: XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin is not usable in an SE application

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Inactive items that will be automatically closed if not resurrected

issue.body:
`XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin` uses classes from `javax.transaction` and so is not usable in a simple standalone program. It would be nice if it were usable standalone too or if there were a variant that is usable standalone.

And at the very least documentation should mention it is not usable outside EE.

issue.title: Website documentation and JavaDoc for history plugins is wrong

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Inactive items that will be automatically closed if not resurrected

issue.body: Said documentations for job and trigger history plugins state that it logs with JCL while they are logging with SLF4J (now).

issue.title: suspend method in docs

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Inactive items that will be automatically closed if not resurrected

issue.body: http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.3.0/cookbook/ShutdownScheduler.html mentions a `suspend` method. I guess this should be `standby`.

issue.title: Documentation on Website is not for latest version

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Inactive items that will be automatically closed if not resurrected

issue.body: Latest version is 2.3.1, but documentation says it is snapshot and latest version is 2.3.0.

issue.title: XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin has a dependency on quartz-jobs

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Inactive items that will be automatically closed if not resurrected

issue.body: `XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin` which is part of the `quartz` artifact implements the interface `FileScanListener` which is in the `quarts-jobs` artifact but there is no dependency declared, not even an optional one.

issue.title: Can support for Aryion, AKA Eka's Portal, be added?
issue.body:
I love this grabber, but one of the sites I use most is unsupported, and I'm not capable enough to add it myself using the steps in the Compilation document, as it does not use an already-included source file.

It would be great if the next release includes built-in functionality to view and download from Aryion.com's image board.

Alternatively, if somebody could provide instructions on how to add this site myself, I would be most grateful.

Thank you!

issue.title: [Bug]: screenshot clips element
issue.body: ### Bug description Hi folks! To reproduce, attempt to screenshot the following element: `/html/body/div[1]/div[1]/article/div/section[7]/dl[3]/dd/span/img` on the page: `https://www.wikiwand.com/en/random_forest` The screenshot turns out like this: Here is how I am configuring the page with puppeteer: I notice I can fix the clipping if I expand the page viewport at the beginning of program execution. However, this changes the way the rest of the screenshots I would like to capture will render. Is there a way I can avoid this clipping without changing the global viewport settings on the page? When I try to change the viewport at the site of every screenshot, I get a wide variety of odd artifacts showing up in the end result screenshots. This might be due to the fact that I have already gathered the elements I would like to screenshot with the previous viewport settings. ### Puppeteer version zenika-alpinechrome-withpuppeteer@1.0.0 , @cliqz/adblocker-puppeteer@1.23.9, puppeteer@6.0.0 ### Node.js version v18.7.0 ### npm version 8.18.0 ### What operating system are you seeing the problem on? macOS ### Relevant log output _No response_

#855 

I've partially added the virtual device but in the wrong place. Not really sure where this is supposed to go or how to connect the bike's features to BT.

It's delivering:
- speed
- cadence
- heart rate
- steering

To use, the bike must first be enabled in Settings / Bike Options / Trixter X-Dream V1 Bike Options. From there you can turn the steering on and off, and adjust the steering calibration, which allows the user to specify which uncalibrated steering values are to be mapped to -45, dead zone left, dead zone right, +45.

issue.title: Trim Reblogs: Hide or warn about Tumblr "Remove reblog trail" button

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
### Concept

Tumblr's native red "remove reblog trail" button leads to significant user confusion when using trim reblogs, since if you install the script and open a reblog form, you will of course expect to see a UI button to trim reblogs, and XKit Rewritten's UI elements are not unique-looking.

We should either hide this button or make an infobox appear when hovering it.

Additionally, a first-use modal for Trim Reblogs when you open the beta reblog form with a trimmable post may be a good idea.

issue.title: Add device name to all HTML pages for easy reference during enrolment, scanning, etc

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When using the /devices and /devices/fingerprints screen it is easy to forget which device you are connected to as there is no indication of the device hostname on the display.
The <title> of these pages, thus the browser tab, has the static text "ESPresense: devices" and therefore does not help either when you have multiple devices open at the same time.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Please add the device name, hostname, to the /devices and /devices/fingerprints screens.
Perhaps just in the left-hand pane, under the existing "ESPresense" logo.
It would also be handy to have the IP address, and version info displayed here as well.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Although the name could be part of the html <title> and hence displayed in the browser tab, it would be truncated and not always visible.

**Additional context**
I currently have 8x devices (more to be deployed shortly) and when making changes to several, or choosing one for an enrolment, it is easy to forget which tab is which device.
When viewing the fingerprints screen of multiple devices to triangulate beacons there is no indication of which screen is which esp device.

Whilst not a critical feature, just feel it would greatly ease usability whilst being a minor effort to implement.

Hey @DTTerastar 

This is maybe more of an implementation question than FR, but here we go.

When implementing the solution to a multiroom environment where users may have multiple devices. Is there a way to group sensors together? Like if I am tracking (via ESP) my iPhone, watch and car keys can you group the devices together as one entity?

Im also keen to understand some best practices for this, maybe the above approach is not good practice. Something for the readme maybe?

Any advise would be warmly received

issue.title: Security for opening an entrance door

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I would like to set up a system to open my front door with the phone. In conjunction with Home Assistant, I would like to make an automation that triggers the lock to open.
I noticed that ESPresence distinguishes a device based on its ID. But this represents a risk of identity theft

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The solution would be to manage IDs dynamically and use rotating IDs, maybe on the same principle as Google Authentificator or something else. The goal is to prevent the issuance of an ID that could trigger a process by an unauthorized person.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Another alternative would be to change the ID every time the device has been detected or as soon as it leaves the detection area and this could be managed by Home Assistant.

**Additional context**
A system like this already exists with the unlocking of Tesla vehicles with the phone but I don't know on what principle this authentication is made. I only know that an application (-> Tesla) is necessary for the proper functioning of the process.

Thanks

issue.title: Ability to "name" an enum
issue.body:
Consider this Zod-to-Nexus function:

```ts
export const enumType = <
  S extends
    | z.ZodNativeEnum<any>
    | z.ZodEnum<[string, ...string[]]>
    | z.ZodUnion<[z.ZodLiteral<string>, ...z.ZodLiteral<string>[]]>
>(
  schema: S,
  config?: { name: string; case?: 'camel' | 'snake' }
) => {
  const name = config?.name ?? schema._def.typeName
  const enumifyThis = enumify(config?.case ?? 'snake')
  const members =
    'options' in schema._def
      ? // union case
        schema._def.options.map((_) => _._def.value).map(enumifyThis)
      : // enum case
      Array.isArray(schema._def.values)
      ? schema._def.values.map(enumifyThis)
      : values(schema._def.values)
          .map((_) => String(_))
          .map(enumifyThis)
  return Nexus.enumType({
    name,
    members,
  })
}
```


When using it today it is not possible to capture the enum name so we get code like this:

```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
])

NexusZod.enumType(ExternalErrorDatabaseKindEnum, {
   name: 'ExternalErrorDatabaseKind',
})
```

What I wish we could do is just:

```ts
NexusZod.enumType(ExternalErrorDatabaseKindEnum)
```

Which would I guess be powered by a new Zod method on enums like this:

```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
]).name(`ExternalErrorDatabaseKind`)
```

Or maybe unify name and description under the concept of "metadata":


```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
]).metadata({ name: `ExternalErrorDatabaseKind`, description: 'foobar' })
```

issue.title: Option to let remotes adjust MQTT itho/state
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Remotes connected to the Itho (not the add-on) don't adjust mqtt topic itho/state (probably by design).

**Expected behaviour**
Is it possible to create a option that lets remotes connected to the Itho-unit (not the add-on) adjust MQTT topic itho/state based on the given input on the remote? That way remote commands will be visible through MQTT, while maintaining all standard functionality of the RFT CO2 230V being connected to the Itho-unit.

**Device information**
- Current firmware version: 2.4.0-alpha8
- Hardware revision: 2
- CC1101 RF module enabled: yes

issue.title: Copying between diagrams
issue.body:
* [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/jgraph/drawio/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
* [x] I have searched the issue tracker for a feature request that matches the one I want to file, without success.

**Describe the bug**
When copying a shape from a multi sheet draw.io document, and pasting into another draw.io document the shape isn't copied to the sheet being viewed. The paste operation will create empty sheet(s) to mimic the source sheet-layout and copy the shape there.

The user then need to drag the shape through the diagram, which could be over multiple sheets, to where it needs the shape to be.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a diagram with more than one sheet, say a 2 wide x 3 tall. Put any shape in the bottom right page. Copy the shape.
2. Make another diagram with one sheet. Try to paste the shape to the location you are viewing.

**Expected behavior**
The shape should be copied to the sheet being viewed, preferably place in the viewable section of that sheet.

**draw.io version (In the Help->About menu of the draw.io editor):**

- draw.io version [17.4.2]

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [macOS]

issue.title: Arrays of numbers do not appear to be processed as expected

labels.name: checks
labels.description: Check additions or changes

issue.body:
This issue description will be based off the following Terraform:
```
resource "google_compute_firewall" "should_pass_01" {
  name    = "test-firewall2"
  network = "network_name"

  allow {
    protocol = "tcp"
    ports = ["21"]
  }
}

resource "google_compute_firewall" "should_pass_02" {
  name    = "test-firewall2"
  network = "network_name"

  allow {
    protocol = "tcp"
    ports = ["21", "443"]
  }
}
```
And this policy:
```
---
metadata:
  id: 'custom_policy_id_000356'
  name: 'Firewall restricts traffic on SSH port (22)'
  guidelines: 'Do not use e2-micro instance type'
  category: 'networking'
  severity: 'critical'
scope:
  provider: 'gcp'
definition:
  cond_type: 'attribute'
  resource_types:
    - 'google_compute_firewall'
  attribute: 'allow.ports'
  operator: 'not_contains'
  value: '22'
```
**Describe the issue**
Both resources above should pass. This first is neither passed, failed, or skipped. It errors out and is silently ignored.  I debugged the code to some level and by the time the actual comparison is done in the `common/checks_infra/solvers/attribute_solvers/contains_attribute_solver.py`, the resource value of `['21']` has not only been converted to s standalone value of `'21'` but also a numeric value of `21`. The comparison for the contains/not_contains operator uses the python `in` and thus the ultimate comparison made is `'22' in 21` which throws an exception since an int isn't iterable. 

It would also be incorrect for the comparison to be `'22' in '21'` as (I think) that would iterate over the characters in the string. The correct comparison, and the one that occurs where there's more that one value in the resource array, would seem to be the one that's expected by the way the policy and resources is written; i.e. `'22' in ['21']`. 

When the comparison is made on the second resource, it works as expected: `'21' in ['21', '443']`. 

Yes, I know that there is a python check that already performs this exact port check, but I'm making the point with an example. 

**Examples**
Provided above. 

**Version (please complete the following information):**
 - Checkov Version:  2.0.1050

issue.title: [Kill Process] ...Showing irrelevant % of usage?

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: extension
labels.description: Issues related to one of the extensions in the Store

issue.body:
# Extension – [Kill Process](https://github.com/raycast/extensions/tree/161ef683e135825a8fef68699742aca55ebca9ff/extensions/kill-process/)
Author: Harun Jonuzi

<!--
Please provide a clear and concise description of what the bug is. Include
screenshots if needed. Please test using the latest version of the extension, Raycast and API.
-->
## Description

In my kill process extension from raycast you can clearly see that "syspolicyd" is showing that 75% of cpu is being used, everytime I re-run the extension it goes back and forth from 65% to 80%, it started to worry me how can it waste that much of cpu power? Then I run the Activity Monitor from macbook and saw that the "syspolicyd" is actually using 0% of cpu, so I am really concerned to which one is accurate? Or is it a buf of the Extension?

I did some research and found that this "syspolicyd" is a gateway keeper for scanning files on macbook, in the past it used to be a huge problem because it wasted alot of battery on users, but nowadays it is fixed.

That is my only concern, is the extension bugged, how accurate is this extension in showing % of the processes being used by the CPU?
-----
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97728749/190633510-d4ad6652-8a55-4791-9cf1-e08e944bf5ce.png)


## Steps To Reproduce

1. Run raycasat
2. Open Kill Process
3.  See the % Results

<!--
Your bug will get fixed much faster if the extension author can easily reproduce it. Issues without reproduction steps may be immediately closed as not actionable.
-->

## The current behavior

1. Not showing correct % of processes that are being used by the CPU?

## The expected behavior

1. It has to show the correct % of the processes that are being used by the CPU.

### Raycast version
<!-- Please find your current version of Raycast by clicking on the Raycast logo in your menu bar -->

Raycast version 1.39.3

Change Log

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. This project adheres to Semantic Versioning. This change log adheres to standards from Keep a CHANGELOG.

Unreleased

Added

  • support new config system (#3429[] @​jjangga0214)
  • [hook-use-state]: add allowDestructuredState option (#3449[] @​ljharb)
  • add [sort-default-props] and deprecate [jsx-sort-default-props] (#1861[] @​alexzherdev)

  • [Docs] [no-unstable-nested-components]: Warn about memoized, nested components (#3444[] @​eps1lon)

issue.body:
Bumps [@babel/core](https://github.com/babel/babel/tree/HEAD/packages/babel-core) from 7.17.9 to 7.19.6.
Release notes

Sourced from @​babel/core's releases.

v7.19.6 (2022-10-20)

Thanks @​lomirus for your first PR!

:eyeglasses: Spec Compliance

  • babel-plugin-proposal-decorators
    • #15059 Ensure non-static decorators are applied when a class is instantiated. (@​JLHwung)

:bug: Bug Fix

  • babel-parser
    • #15062 Fix parsing of block comments nested in flow comments (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
    • #15052 fix: improve module block program location tracking (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-plugin-transform-runtime, babel-runtime-corejs2, babel-runtime-corejs3
    • #15060 Ensure @babel/runtime-corejs3/core-js/*.js can be imported on Node.js 17+ (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-preset-env, babel-traverse
    • #15043 fix: preserve this for super.* template tags (@​liuxingbaoyu)

issue.title: Square Bracket in JSDoc @param issue
issue.body:
When using square brackets in `@param` to define [optional parameters within JSDoc ](https://jsdoc.app/tags-param.html#optional-parameters-and-default-values) (e.g. `@param {Request} [request]`) the whole `@swagger` annotation will not get processed.

```
	/**
	 * Description
	 *
	 * @private
	 * @async
	 * @param {Request} [request]
	 * @param {JSONResponse} [response]
	 * @memberof SftpgoController
	 * @swagger
	 * /v1/getToken:
	 *  get:
	 *   security: []
	 *   tags:
	 *    - getToken
	 *   responses:
	 *    '200':
	 *     description: successful operation
	 *     content:
	 *      application/json:
	 *       schema:
	 *        type: object
	 *        properties:
	 *         success:
	 *          type: boolean
	 *         data:
	 *          type: object
	 *          items:
	 *          properties:
	 *           access_token:
	 *            type: string
	 *            example: 'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...'
	 *           expires_at:
	 *            type: string
	 *            example: '2022-09-04T06:17:59Z'
	 *           current_time:
	 *            type: string
	 *            example: '2022-09-04T06:17:59Z'
	 */
```

No console logs are being printed, the /v1/getToken path is just completly missing.

Removing the square brackets (`@param {Request} [request]` -> `@param {Request} request`) makes it work again and the spec is available again.


Using swagger-jsdoc 6.2.5 with swagger-ui-express

issue.title: Support Kotlin top level functions as test methods
issue.body:
In Kotlin, functions are first class citizens and do not need the context of a class definition.
Idiomatic Kotlin often tries to avoid as much code as possible.
The current implementation of JUnit Jupiter does not allow to execute such top level functions as tests.
As Kotlin top level functions are compiled to static JVM methods with a predictable class name and an annotation identifying the generated class as a Kotlin class, it should be possible to add such support.

Complete example of tests without a class definition:

````kotlin
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test


@Test
fun failure() = assertTrue(false)

@Test
fun success() = assertTrue(true)

````

Careful thought about possible limitations to life-cycle methods might be in order.


## Deliverables

- add ability to execute Kotlin top level functions as tests

issue.title: api: change infra roles to grants-based roles

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: A request or change that improves functional suitability.

issue.body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Infra roles are currently hard-coded things that exist in the codebase. This deprives us of an opportunity to use the grant system for grant-based roles––that we expect users to use––and use the opportunity to learn from it and improve the authorization system.

## Describe the solution you'd like

The grants system supports defining roles as grants.

- permissions can be defined as grants. define those permissions.
- Define Infra roles as grants composed of permissions.
- use the grants system to answer questions about whether users have access to specific resources, rather than whether they have a specific role.

## Additional context

I'll write up some docs on how I see permission and role definitions working as grant declarations.

issue.title: Metadata and TriggerAuthentication are NOT interchangeable

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: stale
labels.description: All issues that are marked as stale due to inactivity

issue.body:
As a new Keda user, I tried to setup the Kafka scaler and ran into the following documentation regarding authentication:
https://keda.sh/docs/2.8/concepts/authentication/#re-use-credentials-and-delegate-auth-with-triggerauthentication

On this page, it mentions both:
```
Every parameter you define in TriggerAuthentication definition does not need to be included in the metadata of the trigger for your ScaledObject definition. To reference a TriggerAuthentication from a ScaledObject you add the authenticationRef to the trigger.
```
and
```
Some metadata parameters will not allow resolving from a literal value, and will instead require a reference to a secret, config map, or environment variable defined on the target container.
```

The first one of the above seems to suggest that metadata and TriggerAuthentication entries are interchangeable.
The latter tells the opposite.

This is rather confusing.

issue.title: A bug in scenario_simulator in the presence of multiple parking lots

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

Related discussion: https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/discussions/2576

The parking scenario in Autoware behaves oddly when there exist multiple parking lots on a map.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44218668/166207450-2950ad13-2281-4e24-abee-ccaeef6625cb.mp4

When I initialized a robot on a parking_lot, the planning module selects a parking scenario even though the goal parking_space is on the other parking_lot.

From now on, I will refer to `parking_space` as a parking spot and `parking_lot` as a parking area (the same way as defined in lanelet2).

### Expected behavior

It is expected that the vehicle select lane_driving to approach the parking lot nearby the goal, and once it arrived, it should change its mode to parking scenario.

### Actual behavior

The planning module outputs a parking scenario trajectory even though the goal parking_space is on the other parking_lot area.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Build [this meta-repository](https://github.com/team-tier4-FY22/autoware.diff_drive)
2. Download [this file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UjogQQPqm0Yc3tRLgUhjtGaj0TOY6dQQ/view?usp=sharing)

3. Launch autoware_launch with the following command
```
$ ros2 launch autoware_launch autoware.launch.xml vehicle_model:=sample_diff_drive sensor_model:=sample_diff_drive_sensor_kit map_path:=YOUR_MAP_PATH
```
4. On RViz, initialize the vehicle position on a parking_lot, and set the goal to a parking_space that is not on the parking_lot in which the vehicle is
5. See the calculated path on RViz

### Versions

- OS: Ubuntu 20.04
- ROS2: galactic
- Autoware (commit ID of autoware): af25faddd16bf8f9a1bace814b0f82e020803f5b

### Possible causes

It seems that this issue is caused by a bug in `scenario_selector`.
It appears that it proceeds to the parking scenario when the following two conditions are met:
1. the goal is on a `parking_space`
2. the vehicle is on the nearest `parking_lot`

However, when multiple `parking_lot` exist, the vehicle starts parking even though it's on a different `parking_lot` that corresponds to its goal `parking_space`. 

### Additional context
Related PR(draft): https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/pull/860
_No response_

issue.title: GIFs added via built-in picker don't stretch with over-scroll animation
issue.body:
<!-- This is a bug report template. By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information, you will help the developers get all the necessary data to fix your issue.
You can also preview your report before submitting it. You may remove sections that aren't relevant to your particular case.

Before we begin, please note that this tracker is only for issues. It is not for questions, comments, or feature requests.

If you would like to discuss a new feature or submit suggestions, please visit the community forum:
https://community.signalusers.org

If you are looking for support, please visit our support center:
https://support.signal.org/
or email support@signal.org

Let's begin with a checklist: Replace the empty checkboxes [ ] below with checked ones [x] accordingly. -->

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates
- [x] I am submitting a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended
- [x] I have read https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports
- [x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic

----------------------------------------

### Bug description
When over-scrolling in a chat, MP4 "GIFs" don't stretch.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Send a GIF using the built-in picker
2. Scroll to the bottom of the chat
3. Attempt to continue scrolling the chat

**Actual result:** Chat contents stretch slightly, *except* for the GIF
**Expected result:** The GIF should stretch along with everything else

issue.title: Immediate "Session has expired, please login again" with new installation, default user
issue.body:
I have build shiori from source in a Raspberry Pi 3 LXC privileged container, and I can successfully start it as a systemd service. I can verify it is listening on port 8080, however when I try to login via the default user and password I immediately get presented with a message:

"Session has expired, please login again."

At this point I cannot proceed.

Here is my systemd service file:

`[Unit]
Description=Shiori service

[Service]
User=shiori
Group=shiori
ExecStart=/home/shiori/go/bin/shiori serve --portable
Restart=always

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
`

My browser is FF 60.7.1 ESR and I am on a Debian-based desktop environment.

Any thoughts on how to continue?

issue.title: Session Freezing by JPEG Upload
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Possibly crash a Session with Uploading an unmodified JPGE as Presentation.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. As Moderator upload a JPEG (attached File not modified Iphone8 )
2. Acknowledge the Upload and return to the Meeting Area
3. Wait for Convert and Rendering of the Image 

**Expected behavior**
Image Upload and conversion and presentation working flawless 

**Actual behavior**
Browser Raises "website not responding ..."
The Presetation change to white (not the uploaded Image neither the Previous Presentation)
Other participants browser freezes also or get thrown out of the session

**Screenshots**
Attached Screenshot is the wating page of the Browser

**BBB version:**
Tested on 2.4.2 Build 2478
Tested on test.bigbluebutton.org with build 2497

issue.title: docs: add draft for server-side usage description to readme
issue.body:
## What

This PR adds a description to the readme for how to use the client with SSR and Next.js

## Why

We do get question about this fairly often, and while we've been saying for a long time that we want to make it easier to use the client with SSR, we haven't actually done that yet. So for now, I suggest adding this to the readme (as suggested in [this issue comment (#50)](https://github.com/Unleash/proxy-client-react/issues/50#issuecomment-1225274676))

## How

By adding a separate "SSR" subsection to the "Usage section" that uses information from #40 and #50 to explain how to use it and its current drawbacks.

## Author's request

I haven't actually used Next.js myself so I'm a bit shaky when it comes to how everything works and what options we have. I'd love some input and some help co-authoring this bit.

issue.title: error: Abort trap: 6 (in target 'lottie-react-native' from project 'Pods')
issue.body: Hi! 👋 Firstly, thanks for your work on this project! 🙂 Today I used [patch-package](https://github.com/ds300/patch-package) to patch `lottie-react-native@5.1.4` for the project I'm working on. Here is the diff that solved my problem: ```diff diff --git a/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec b/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec index d2c5424..9f72471 100644 --- a/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec +++ b/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec @@ -22,5 +22,5 @@ Pod::Spec.new do |s| s.pod_target_xcconfig = { 'DEFINES_MODULE' => 'YES' } s.swift_version = "5.0" s.dependency 'React-Core' - s.dependency 'lottie-ios', '~> 3.4.0' + s.dependency 'lottie-ios', '~> 3.1.8' end ``` This issue body was [partially generated by patch-package](https://github.com/ds300/patch-package/issues/296).

issue.title: Can support for Aryion, AKA Eka's Portal, be added?
issue.body:
I love this grabber, but one of the sites I use most is unsupported, and I'm not capable enough to add it myself using the steps in the Compilation document, as it does not use an already-included source file.

It would be great if the next release includes built-in functionality to view and download from Aryion.com's image board.

Alternatively, if somebody could provide instructions on how to add this site myself, I would be most grateful.

issue.title: Suggestion: Add pool-settings such as maximum-lifetime
issue.body:
Add pool-settings so I'm able to change the maximum lifetime and stop the spam messages like 
`[22:54:33 WARN]: [net.coreprotect.hikari.pool.PoolBase] HikariPool-1 - Failed to validate connection com.mysql.cj.jdbc.ConnectionImpl@237e1fbb (No operations allowed after connection closed.). Possibly consider using a shorter maxLifetime value.`
I know this is already possible since luck perms have this on its config file or maybe just a toggle to stop the warning messages. Thank you!

labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [github.com/spf13/viper](https://github.com/spf13/viper) from 1.7.1 to 1.13.0.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/spf13/viper's releases.

v1.13.0

Important: This is the last release supporting Go 1.15.

What's Changed

Exciting New Features 🎉

  • Add etcd3 to supported remote providers by @​franklinkim in spf13/viper#1371

Enhancements 🚀

  • Fix go-staticcheck failures (ST1005) by @​mjmaisey in spf13/viper#1373
  • Use jsonc in markdown codeblocks for better readability by @​HurSungYun in spf13/viper#1393
  • Add Go 1.19 support by @​sagikazarmark in spf13/viper#1424
  • Adds support for uint16 with GetUint16 by @​oxisto in spf13/viper#1405
  • Add a DebugTo convenience funtion by @​bcrochet in spf13/viper#1414

Bug Fixes 🐛

  • Recurse into arrays when converting keys to lowercase by @​awrichar in spf13/viper#1387

Dependency Updates ⬆️

  • build(deps): bump github.com/stretchr/testify from 1.7.1 to 1.7.2 by @​dependabot in spf13/viper#1374
  • build(deps): bump github.com/subosito/gotenv from 1.3.0 to 1.4.0 by @​dependabot in spf13/viper#1375

v1.12.0

This release makes YAML v3 and TOML v2 the default versions used for encoding.

You can switch back to the old versions by adding viper_yaml2 and viper_toml1 to the build tags.

Please note that YAML v2 and TOML v1 are considered deprecated from this release and may be removed in a future release.

issue.title: Managed Preferences

labels.name: Type: Feature Request
labels.description: Issue is a new feature proposal

issue.body:
### Before opening the issue, have you...?

- [X] Searched for existing issues

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

I'm packaging MonitorControl at work and I need to control updates manually. I actually can't control any preferences using my MDM platform.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Use the /Library/Preferences to control MC configurations. First I need to control _Automatically Check for Update_ setting and be able to disable the  _Check for updates.._ menu.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Blocking update retrieve by FW rules

### Anything else?

thanks for your work !

issue.title: [Bug]: screenshot clips element
issue.body: ### Bug description Hi folks! To reproduce, attempt to screenshot the following element: `/html/body/div[1]/div[1]/article/div/section[7]/dl[3]/dd/span/img` on the page: `https://www.wikiwand.com/en/random_forest` The screenshot turns out like this: Here is how I am configuring the page with puppeteer: I notice I can fix the clipping if I expand the page viewport at the beginning of program execution. However, this changes the way the rest of the screenshots I would like to capture will render. Is there a way I can avoid this clipping without changing the global viewport settings on the page? When I try to change the viewport at the site of every screenshot, I get a wide variety of odd artifacts showing up in the end result screenshots. This might be due to the fact that I have already gathered the elements I would like to screenshot with the previous viewport settings. ### Puppeteer version zenika-alpinechrome-withpuppeteer@1.0.0 , @cliqz/adblocker-puppeteer@1.23.9, puppeteer@6.0.0 ### Node.js version v18.7.0 ### npm version 8.18.0 ### What operating system are you seeing the problem on? macOS ### Relevant log output _No response_

issue.title: #855 Support for the Trixter X-Dream V1 bike
issue.body:
#855 

I've partially added the virtual device but in the wrong place. Not really sure where this is supposed to go or how to connect the bike's features to BT.

It's delivering:
- speed
- cadence
- heart rate
- steering

To use, the bike must first be enabled in Settings / Bike Options / Trixter X-Dream V1 Bike Options. From there you can turn the steering on and off, and adjust the steering calibration, which allows the user to specify which uncalibrated steering values are to be mapped to -45, dead zone left, dead zone right, +45.

issue.title: Trim Reblogs: Hide or warn about Tumblr "Remove reblog trail" button

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
### Concept

Tumblr's native red "remove reblog trail" button leads to significant user confusion when using trim reblogs, since if you install the script and open a reblog form, you will of course expect to see a UI button to trim reblogs, and XKit Rewritten's UI elements are not unique-looking.

We should either hide this button or make an infobox appear when hovering it.

Additionally, a first-use modal for Trim Reblogs when you open the beta reblog form with a trimmable post may be a good idea.

issue.title: Add device name to all HTML pages for easy reference during enrolment, scanning, etc

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When using the /devices and /devices/fingerprints screen it is easy to forget which device you are connected to as there is no indication of the device hostname on the display.
The <title> of these pages, thus the browser tab, has the static text "ESPresense: devices" and therefore does not help either when you have multiple devices open at the same time.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Please add the device name, hostname, to the /devices and /devices/fingerprints screens.
Perhaps just in the left-hand pane, under the existing "ESPresense" logo.
It would also be handy to have the IP address, and version info displayed here as well.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Although the name could be part of the html <title> and hence displayed in the browser tab, it would be truncated and not always visible.

**Additional context**
I currently have 8x devices (more to be deployed shortly) and when making changes to several, or choosing one for an enrolment, it is easy to forget which tab is which device.
When viewing the fingerprints screen of multiple devices to triangulate beacons there is no indication of which screen is which esp device.

Whilst not a critical feature, just feel it would greatly ease usability whilst being a minor effort to implement.

issue.title: Security for opening an entrance door

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I would like to set up a system to open my front door with the phone. In conjunction with Home Assistant, I would like to make an automation that triggers the lock to open.
I noticed that ESPresence distinguishes a device based on its ID. But this represents a risk of identity theft

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The solution would be to manage IDs dynamically and use rotating IDs, maybe on the same principle as Google Authentificator or something else. The goal is to prevent the issuance of an ID that could trigger a process by an unauthorized person.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Another alternative would be to change the ID every time the device has been detected or as soon as it leaves the detection area and this could be managed by Home Assistant.

**Additional context**
A system like this already exists with the unlocking of Tesla vehicles with the phone but I don't know on what principle this authentication is made. I only know that an application (-> Tesla) is necessary for the proper functioning of the process.

Thanks

issue.title: Ability to "name" an enum
issue.body:
Consider this Zod-to-Nexus function:

```ts
export const enumType = <
  S extends
    | z.ZodNativeEnum<any>
    | z.ZodEnum<[string, ...string[]]>
    | z.ZodUnion<[z.ZodLiteral<string>, ...z.ZodLiteral<string>[]]>
>(
  schema: S,
  config?: { name: string; case?: 'camel' | 'snake' }
) => {
  const name = config?.name ?? schema._def.typeName
  const enumifyThis = enumify(config?.case ?? 'snake')
  const members =
    'options' in schema._def
      ? // union case
        schema._def.options.map((_) => _._def.value).map(enumifyThis)
      : // enum case
      Array.isArray(schema._def.values)
      ? schema._def.values.map(enumifyThis)
      : values(schema._def.values)
          .map((_) => String(_))
          .map(enumifyThis)
  return Nexus.enumType({
    name,
    members,
  })
}
```


When using it today it is not possible to capture the enum name so we get code like this:

```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
])

NexusZod.enumType(ExternalErrorDatabaseKindEnum, {
   name: 'ExternalErrorDatabaseKind',
})
```

What I wish we could do is just:

```ts
NexusZod.enumType(ExternalErrorDatabaseKindEnum)
```

Which would I guess be powered by a new Zod method on enums like this:

```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
]).name(`ExternalErrorDatabaseKind`)
```

Or maybe unify name and description under the concept of "metadata":


```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
]).metadata({ name: `ExternalErrorDatabaseKind`, description: 'foobar' })
```

pull_request.title: Configure Mend Bolt for GitHub
pull_request.body:
Welcome to [Mend Bolt for GitHub](https://github.com/apps/mend-bolt-for-github) (formerly WhiteSource). This is an onboarding PR to help you understand and configure settings before Mend starts scanning your repository for security vulnerabilities.

:vertical_traffic_light: Mend Bolt for GitHub will start scanning your repository only once you merge this Pull Request. To disable Mend Bolt for GitHub, simply close this Pull Request. 



---

### What to Expect

This PR contains a '.whitesource' configuration file which can be customized to your needs. If no changes were applied to this file, Mend Bolt for GitHub will use the default configuration.

Before merging this PR, Make sure the [Issues tab is enabled](https://whitesource.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/WD/pages/594641239/Enabling+the+Issues+Tab+for+the+GitHub+Repository). Once you merge this PR, Mend Bolt for GitHub will scan your repository and create a GitHub Issue for every vulnerability detected in your repository. 

If you do not want a GitHub Issue to be created for each detected vulnerability, you can edit the '.whitesource' file and set the 'minSeverityLevel' parameter to 'NONE'. 

---

:question: Got questions? Check out Mend Bolt for GitHub [docs](https://whitesource.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/WD/pages/556007950/WhiteSource+Bolt+for+GitHub).
If you need any further assistance then you can also [request help here](https://whitesourcesoftware.force.com/CustomerCommunity/s).<!-- <WHITESOURCE>{ "installationId": "24860609"}</WHITESOURCE> -->

issue.title: Option to let remotes adjust MQTT itho/state
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Remotes connected to the Itho (not the add-on) don't adjust mqtt topic itho/state (probably by design).

**Expected behaviour**
Is it possible to create a option that lets remotes connected to the Itho-unit (not the add-on) adjust MQTT topic itho/state based on the given input on the remote? That way remote commands will be visible through MQTT, while maintaining all standard functionality of the RFT CO2 230V being connected to the Itho-unit.

**Device information**
- Current firmware version: 2.4.0-alpha8
- Hardware revision: 2
- CC1101 RF module enabled: yes

issue.title: Copying between diagrams
issue.body:
* [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/jgraph/drawio/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
* [x] I have searched the issue tracker for a feature request that matches the one I want to file, without success.

**Describe the bug**
When copying a shape from a multi sheet draw.io document, and pasting into another draw.io document the shape isn't copied to the sheet being viewed. The paste operation will create empty sheet(s) to mimic the source sheet-layout and copy the shape there.

The user then need to drag the shape through the diagram, which could be over multiple sheets, to where it needs the shape to be.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a diagram with more than one sheet, say a 2 wide x 3 tall. Put any shape in the bottom right page. Copy the shape.
2. Make another diagram with one sheet. Try to paste the shape to the location you are viewing.

**Expected behavior**
The shape should be copied to the sheet being viewed, preferably place in the viewable section of that sheet.

**draw.io version (In the Help->About menu of the draw.io editor):**

- draw.io version [17.4.2]

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [macOS]

issue.title: Arrays of numbers do not appear to be processed as expected

labels.name: checks
labels.description: Check additions or changes

issue.body:
This issue description will be based off the following Terraform:
```
resource "google_compute_firewall" "should_pass_01" {
  name    = "test-firewall2"
  network = "network_name"

  allow {
    protocol = "tcp"
    ports = ["21"]
  }
}

resource "google_compute_firewall" "should_pass_02" {
  name    = "test-firewall2"
  network = "network_name"

  allow {
    protocol = "tcp"
    ports = ["21", "443"]
  }
}
```
And this policy:
```
---
metadata:
  id: 'custom_policy_id_000356'
  name: 'Firewall restricts traffic on SSH port (22)'
  guidelines: 'Do not use e2-micro instance type'
  category: 'networking'
  severity: 'critical'
scope:
  provider: 'gcp'
definition:
  cond_type: 'attribute'
  resource_types:
    - 'google_compute_firewall'
  attribute: 'allow.ports'
  operator: 'not_contains'
  value: '22'
```
**Describe the issue**
Both resources above should pass. This first is neither passed, failed, or skipped. It errors out and is silently ignored.  I debugged the code to some level and by the time the actual comparison is done in the `common/checks_infra/solvers/attribute_solvers/contains_attribute_solver.py`, the resource value of `['21']` has not only been converted to s standalone value of `'21'` but also a numeric value of `21`. The comparison for the contains/not_contains operator uses the python `in` and thus the ultimate comparison made is `'22' in 21` which throws an exception since an int isn't iterable. 

It would also be incorrect for the comparison to be `'22' in '21'` as (I think) that would iterate over the characters in the string. The correct comparison, and the one that occurs where there's more that one value in the resource array, would seem to be the one that's expected by the way the policy and resources is written; i.e. `'22' in ['21']`. 

When the comparison is made on the second resource, it works as expected: `'21' in ['21', '443']`. 

Yes, I know that there is a python check that already performs this exact port check, but I'm making the point with an example. 

**Examples**
Provided above. 

**Version (please complete the following information):**
 - Checkov Version:  2.0.1050

comment.body:
Thanks for contributing to Checkov!  We've automatically marked this issue as stale to keep our issues list tidy,  because it has not had any activity for 6 months.  It will be closed in 14 days if no further activity occurs.  Commenting on this issue will remove the stale tag. If you want to talk through the issue or help us understand the priority and context,  feel free to add a comment or join us in the Checkov slack channel at https://slack.bridgecrew.io
Thanks!

labels.name: bug

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

There is no item root_path in the dictionary when adding extra keys. Workaround the problem:
```
diff --git a/TTS/tts/datasets/__init__.py b/TTS/tts/datasets/__init__.py
index eeadf7d3..261e58b2 100644
--- a/TTS/tts/datasets/__init__.py
+++ b/TTS/tts/datasets/__init__.py
@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ def add_extra_keys(metadata, language, dataset_name):
         # add language name
         item["language"] = language
         # add unique audio name
-        relfilepath = os.path.splitext(item["audio_file"].replace(item["root_path"], ""))[0]
+        relfilepath = os.path.splitext(item["audio_file"].replace(str(item.get("root_path") or ''), ""))[0]
         audio_unique_name = f"{dataset_name}#{relfilepath}"
         item["audio_unique_name"] = audio_unique_name
 
```

### To Reproduce

1. run coqui tts
2. cannot train

dev

issue.title: Pin Files in File Search

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: New feature or improvement

labels.name: native land
labels.description: Use the label when issue is not related to api extensions

issue.body:
**Describe the feature and the current behavior/state.**

You can see recent files in the file search but you cannot pin files. 

**Will this change the current API? How?**

Add the ability to pin files in the file search. 

This is available for clipboard history so it makes sense for it to be here as well. 

**Who will benefit from this feature?**

issue.title: [Kill Process] ...Showing irrelevant % of usage?

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: extension
labels.description: Issues related to one of the extensions in the Store

issue.body:
# Extension – [Kill Process](https://github.com/raycast/extensions/tree/161ef683e135825a8fef68699742aca55ebca9ff/extensions/kill-process/)
Author: Harun Jonuzi

<!--
Please provide a clear and concise description of what the bug is. Include
screenshots if needed. Please test using the latest version of the extension, Raycast and API.
-->
## Description

In my kill process extension from raycast you can clearly see that "syspolicyd" is showing that 75% of cpu is being used, everytime I re-run the extension it goes back and forth from 65% to 80%, it started to worry me how can it waste that much of cpu power? Then I run the Activity Monitor from macbook and saw that the "syspolicyd" is actually using 0% of cpu, so I am really concerned to which one is accurate? Or is it a buf of the Extension?

I did some research and found that this "syspolicyd" is a gateway keeper for scanning files on macbook, in the past it used to be a huge problem because it wasted alot of battery on users, but nowadays it is fixed.

That is my only concern, is the extension bugged, how accurate is this extension in showing % of the processes being used by the CPU?
-----
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97728749/190633510-d4ad6652-8a55-4791-9cf1-e08e944bf5ce.png)


## Steps To Reproduce

1. Run raycasat
2. Open Kill Process
3.  See the % Results

<!--
Your bug will get fixed much faster if the extension author can easily reproduce it. Issues without reproduction steps may be immediately closed as not actionable.
-->

## The current behavior

1. Not showing correct % of processes that are being used by the CPU?

## The expected behavior

1. It has to show the correct % of the processes that are being used by the CPU.

### Raycast version
<!-- Please find your current version of Raycast by clicking on the Raycast logo in your menu bar -->

Raycast version 1.39.3

issue.title: Square Bracket in JSDoc @param issue
issue.body:
When using square brackets in `@param` to define [optional parameters within JSDoc ](https://jsdoc.app/tags-param.html#optional-parameters-and-default-values) (e.g. `@param {Request} [request]`) the whole `@swagger` annotation will not get processed.

```
	/**
	 * Description
	 *
	 * @private
	 * @async
	 * @param {Request} [request]
	 * @param {JSONResponse} [response]
	 * @memberof SftpgoController
	 * @swagger
	 * /v1/getToken:
	 *  get:
	 *   security: []
	 *   tags:
	 *    - getToken
	 *   responses:
	 *    '200':
	 *     description: successful operation
	 *     content:
	 *      application/json:
	 *       schema:
	 *        type: object
	 *        properties:
	 *         success:
	 *          type: boolean
	 *         data:
	 *          type: object
	 *          items:
	 *          properties:
	 *           access_token:
	 *            type: string
	 *            example: 'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...'
	 *           expires_at:
	 *            type: string
	 *            example: '2022-09-04T06:17:59Z'
	 *           current_time:
	 *            type: string
	 *            example: '2022-09-04T06:17:59Z'
	 */
```

No console logs are being printed, the /v1/getToken path is just completly missing.

Removing the square brackets (`@param {Request} [request]` -> `@param {Request} request`) makes it work again and the spec is available again.


Using swagger-jsdoc 6.2.5 with swagger-ui-express

issue.title: [Snyk] Security upgrade urllib3 from 1.25.7 to 1.26.5
issue.body:
This PR was automatically created by Snyk using the credentials of a real user.


Snyk has created this PR to fix one or more vulnerable packages in the `pip` dependencies of this project.

issue.title: Support Kotlin top level functions as test methods
issue.body:
In Kotlin, functions are first class citizens and do not need the context of a class definition.
Idiomatic Kotlin often tries to avoid as much code as possible.
The current implementation of JUnit Jupiter does not allow to execute such top level functions as tests.
As Kotlin top level functions are compiled to static JVM methods with a predictable class name and an annotation identifying the generated class as a Kotlin class, it should be possible to add such support.

Complete example of tests without a class definition:

````kotlin
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test


@Test
fun failure() = assertTrue(false)

@Test
fun success() = assertTrue(true)

````

Careful thought about possible limitations to life-cycle methods might be in order.


## Deliverables

- add ability to execute Kotlin top level functions as tests

issue.title: api: change infra roles to grants-based roles

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: A request or change that improves functional suitability.

issue.body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Infra roles are currently hard-coded things that exist in the codebase. This deprives us of an opportunity to use the grant system for grant-based roles––that we expect users to use––and use the opportunity to learn from it and improve the authorization system.

## Describe the solution you'd like

The grants system supports defining roles as grants.

- permissions can be defined as grants. define those permissions.
- Define Infra roles as grants composed of permissions.
- use the grants system to answer questions about whether users have access to specific resources, rather than whether they have a specific role.

## Additional context

I'll write up some docs on how I see permission and role definitions working as grant declarations.

issue.title: Metadata and TriggerAuthentication are NOT interchangeable

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: stale
labels.description: All issues that are marked as stale due to inactivity

issue.body:
As a new Keda user, I tried to setup the Kafka scaler and ran into the following documentation regarding authentication:
https://keda.sh/docs/2.8/concepts/authentication/#re-use-credentials-and-delegate-auth-with-triggerauthentication

On this page, it mentions both:
```
Every parameter you define in TriggerAuthentication definition does not need to be included in the metadata of the trigger for your ScaledObject definition. To reference a TriggerAuthentication from a ScaledObject you add the authenticationRef to the trigger.
```
and
```
Some metadata parameters will not allow resolving from a literal value, and will instead require a reference to a secret, config map, or environment variable defined on the target container.
```

The first one of the above seems to suggest that metadata and TriggerAuthentication entries are interchangeable.
The latter tells the opposite.

This is rather confusing.

issue.title: A bug in scenario_simulator in the presence of multiple parking lots

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I've searched other issues and no duplicate issues were found.
- [X] I'm convinced that this is not my fault but a bug.

### Description

Related discussion: https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/discussions/2576

The parking scenario in Autoware behaves oddly when there exist multiple parking lots on a map.
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44218668/166207450-2950ad13-2281-4e24-abee-ccaeef6625cb.mp4

When I initialized a robot on a parking_lot, the planning module selects a parking scenario even though the goal parking_space is on the other parking_lot.

From now on, I will refer to `parking_space` as a parking spot and `parking_lot` as a parking area (the same way as defined in lanelet2).

### Expected behavior

It is expected that the vehicle select lane_driving to approach the parking lot nearby the goal, and once it arrived, it should change its mode to parking scenario.

### Actual behavior

The planning module outputs a parking scenario trajectory even though the goal parking_space is on the other parking_lot area.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Build [this meta-repository](https://github.com/team-tier4-FY22/autoware.diff_drive)
2. Download [this file](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UjogQQPqm0Yc3tRLgUhjtGaj0TOY6dQQ/view?usp=sharing)

3. Launch autoware_launch with the following command
```
$ ros2 launch autoware_launch autoware.launch.xml vehicle_model:=sample_diff_drive sensor_model:=sample_diff_drive_sensor_kit map_path:=YOUR_MAP_PATH
```
4. On RViz, initialize the vehicle position on a parking_lot, and set the goal to a parking_space that is not on the parking_lot in which the vehicle is
5. See the calculated path on RViz

### Versions

- OS: Ubuntu 20.04
- ROS2: galactic
- Autoware (commit ID of autoware): af25faddd16bf8f9a1bace814b0f82e020803f5b

### Possible causes

It seems that this issue is caused by a bug in `scenario_selector`.
It appears that it proceeds to the parking scenario when the following two conditions are met:
1. the goal is on a `parking_space`
2. the vehicle is on the nearest `parking_lot`

However, when multiple `parking_lot` exist, the vehicle starts parking even though it's on a different `parking_lot` that corresponds to its goal `parking_space`. 

### Additional context
Related PR(draft): https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware.universe/pull/860
_No response_

issue.body:
I have build shiori from source in a Raspberry Pi 3 LXC privileged container, and I can successfully start it as a systemd service. I can verify it is listening on port 8080, however when I try to login via the default user and password I immediately get presented with a message:

"Session has expired, please login again."

At this point I cannot proceed.

Here is my systemd service file:

`[Unit]
Description=Shiori service

[Service]
User=shiori
Group=shiori
ExecStart=/home/shiori/go/bin/shiori serve --portable
Restart=always

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
`

My browser is FF 60.7.1 ESR and I am on a Debian-based desktop environment.

Any thoughts on how to continue?

issue.title: docs: add draft for server-side usage description to readme
issue.body:
## What

This PR adds a description to the readme for how to use the client with SSR and Next.js

## Why

We do get question about this fairly often, and while we've been saying for a long time that we want to make it easier to use the client with SSR, we haven't actually done that yet. So for now, I suggest adding this to the readme (as suggested in [this issue comment (#50)](https://github.com/Unleash/proxy-client-react/issues/50#issuecomment-1225274676))

## How

By adding a separate "SSR" subsection to the "Usage section" that uses information from #40 and #50 to explain how to use it and its current drawbacks.

## Author's request

I haven't actually used Next.js myself so I'm a bit shaky when it comes to how everything works and what options we have. I'd love some input and some help co-authoring this bit.

issue.title: error: Abort trap: 6 (in target 'lottie-react-native' from project 'Pods')
issue.body: Hi! 👋 Firstly, thanks for your work on this project! 🙂 Today I used [patch-package](https://github.com/ds300/patch-package) to patch `lottie-react-native@5.1.4` for the project I'm working on. Here is the diff that solved my problem: ```diff diff --git a/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec b/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec index d2c5424..9f72471 100644 --- a/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec +++ b/node_modules/lottie-react-native/lottie-react-native.podspec @@ -22,5 +22,5 @@ Pod::Spec.new do |s| s.pod_target_xcconfig = { 'DEFINES_MODULE' => 'YES' } s.swift_version = "5.0" s.dependency 'React-Core' - s.dependency 'lottie-ios', '~> 3.4.0' + s.dependency 'lottie-ios', '~> 3.1.8' end ``` This issue body was [partially generated by patch-package](https://github.com/ds300/patch-package/issues/296).

issue.title: Suggestion: Add pool-settings such as maximum-lifetime
issue.body:
Add pool-settings so I'm able to change the maximum lifetime and stop the spam messages like 
`[22:54:33 WARN]: [net.coreprotect.hikari.pool.PoolBase] HikariPool-1 - Failed to validate connection com.mysql.cj.jdbc.ConnectionImpl@237e1fbb (No operations allowed after connection closed.). Possibly consider using a shorter maxLifetime value.`
I know this is already possible since luck perms have this on its config file or maybe just a toggle to stop the warning messages. Thank you!

issue.body:
Bumps [github.com/spf13/viper](https://github.com/spf13/viper) from 1.7.1 to 1.13.0.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/spf13/viper's releases.

v1.13.0

Important: This is the last release supporting Go 1.15.

What's Changed

Exciting New Features 🎉

  • Add etcd3 to supported remote providers by @​franklinkim in spf13/viper#1371

Enhancements 🚀

  • Fix go-staticcheck failures (ST1005) by @​mjmaisey in spf13/viper#1373
  • Use jsonc in markdown codeblocks for better readability by @​HurSungYun in spf13/viper#1393
  • Add Go 1.19 support by @​sagikazarmark in spf13/viper#1424
  • Adds support for uint16 with GetUint16 by @​oxisto in spf13/viper#1405
  • Add a DebugTo convenience funtion by @​bcrochet in spf13/viper#1414

Bug Fixes 🐛

  • Recurse into arrays when converting keys to lowercase by @​awrichar in spf13/viper#1387

This release makes YAML v3 and TOML v2 the default versions used for encoding.

You can switch back to the old versions by adding viper_yaml2 and viper_toml1 to the build tags.

Please note that YAML v2 and TOML v1 are considered deprecated from this release and may be removed in a future release.

issue.title: Managed Preferences

labels.name: Type: Feature Request
labels.description: Issue is a new feature proposal

issue.body:
### Before opening the issue, have you...?

- [X] Searched for existing issues

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

I'm packaging MonitorControl at work and I need to control updates manually. I actually can't control any preferences using my MDM platform.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Use the /Library/Preferences to control MC configurations. First I need to control _Automatically Check for Update_ setting and be able to disable the  _Check for updates.._ menu.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Blocking update retrieve by FW rules

### Anything else?

thanks for your work !

issue.title: [Bug]: screenshot clips element
issue.body: ### Bug description Hi folks! To reproduce, attempt to screenshot the following element: `/html/body/div[1]/div[1]/article/div/section[7]/dl[3]/dd/span/img` on the page: `https://www.wikiwand.com/en/random_forest` The screenshot turns out like this: Here is how I am configuring the page with puppeteer: I notice I can fix the clipping if I expand the page viewport at the beginning of program execution. However, this changes the way the rest of the screenshots I would like to capture will render. Is there a way I can avoid this clipping without changing the global viewport settings on the page? When I try to change the viewport at the site of every screenshot, I get a wide variety of odd artifacts showing up in the end result screenshots. This might be due to the fact that I have already gathered the elements I would like to screenshot with the previous viewport settings. ### Puppeteer version zenika-alpinechrome-withpuppeteer@1.0.0 , @cliqz/adblocker-puppeteer@1.23.9, puppeteer@6.0.0 ### Node.js version v18.7.0 ### npm version 8.18.0 ### What operating system are you seeing the problem on? macOS ### Relevant log output _No response_

issue.title: #855 Support for the Trixter X-Dream V1 bike
issue.body:
#855 

I've partially added the virtual device but in the wrong place. Not really sure where this is supposed to go or how to connect the bike's features to BT.

It's delivering:
- speed
- cadence
- heart rate
- steering

To use, the bike must first be enabled in Settings / Bike Options / Trixter X-Dream V1 Bike Options. From there you can turn the steering on and off, and adjust the steering calibration, which allows the user to specify which uncalibrated steering values are to be mapped to -45, dead zone left, dead zone right, +45.

issue.title: Trim Reblogs: Hide or warn about Tumblr "Remove reblog trail" button

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
### Concept

Tumblr's native red "remove reblog trail" button leads to significant user confusion when using trim reblogs, since if you install the script and open a reblog form, you will of course expect to see a UI button to trim reblogs, and XKit Rewritten's UI elements are not unique-looking.

We should either hide this button or make an infobox appear when hovering it.

Additionally, a first-use modal for Trim Reblogs when you open the beta reblog form with a trimmable post may be a good idea.

issue.title: Add device name to all HTML pages for easy reference during enrolment, scanning, etc

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When using the /devices and /devices/fingerprints screen it is easy to forget which device you are connected to as there is no indication of the device hostname on the display.
The <title> of these pages, thus the browser tab, has the static text "ESPresense: devices" and therefore does not help either when you have multiple devices open at the same time.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Please add the device name, hostname, to the /devices and /devices/fingerprints screens.
Perhaps just in the left-hand pane, under the existing "ESPresense" logo.
It would also be handy to have the IP address, and version info displayed here as well.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Although the name could be part of the html <title> and hence displayed in the browser tab, it would be truncated and not always visible.

**Additional context**
I currently have 8x devices (more to be deployed shortly) and when making changes to several, or choosing one for an enrolment, it is easy to forget which tab is which device.
When viewing the fingerprints screen of multiple devices to triangulate beacons there is no indication of which screen is which esp device.

Whilst not a critical feature, just feel it would greatly ease usability whilst being a minor effort to implement.

issue.title: Security for opening an entrance door

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I would like to set up a system to open my front door with the phone. In conjunction with Home Assistant, I would like to make an automation that triggers the lock to open.
I noticed that ESPresence distinguishes a device based on its ID. But this represents a risk of identity theft

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The solution would be to manage IDs dynamically and use rotating IDs, maybe on the same principle as Google Authentificator or something else. The goal is to prevent the issuance of an ID that could trigger a process by an unauthorized person.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Another alternative would be to change the ID every time the device has been detected or as soon as it leaves the detection area and this could be managed by Home Assistant.

**Additional context**
A system like this already exists with the unlocking of Tesla vehicles with the phone but I don't know on what principle this authentication is made. I only know that an application (-> Tesla) is necessary for the proper functioning of the process.

Thanks

issue.title: Ability to "name" an enum
issue.body:
Consider this Zod-to-Nexus function:

```ts
export const enumType = <
  S extends
    | z.ZodNativeEnum<any>
    | z.ZodEnum<[string, ...string[]]>
    | z.ZodUnion<[z.ZodLiteral<string>, ...z.ZodLiteral<string>[]]>
>(
  schema: S,
  config?: { name: string; case?: 'camel' | 'snake' }
) => {
  const name = config?.name ?? schema._def.typeName
  const enumifyThis = enumify(config?.case ?? 'snake')
  const members =
    'options' in schema._def
      ? // union case
        schema._def.options.map((_) => _._def.value).map(enumifyThis)
      : // enum case
      Array.isArray(schema._def.values)
      ? schema._def.values.map(enumifyThis)
      : values(schema._def.values)
          .map((_) => String(_))
          .map(enumifyThis)
  return Nexus.enumType({
    name,
    members,
  })
}
```


When using it today it is not possible to capture the enum name so we get code like this:

```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
])

NexusZod.enumType(ExternalErrorDatabaseKindEnum, {
   name: 'ExternalErrorDatabaseKind',
})
```

What I wish we could do is just:

```ts
NexusZod.enumType(ExternalErrorDatabaseKindEnum)
```

Which would I guess be powered by a new Zod method on enums like this:

```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
]).name(`ExternalErrorDatabaseKind`)
```

Or maybe unify name and description under the concept of "metadata":


```ts
const ExternalErrorDatabaseKind = z.enum([
   'IntrospectionFailure',
   'NotEmpty',
   'PushSchemaFailure',
   'SeedFailure',
]).metadata({ name: `ExternalErrorDatabaseKind`, description: 'foobar' })
```

---

### What to Expect

This PR contains a '.whitesource' configuration file which can be customized to your needs. If no changes were applied to this file, Mend Bolt for GitHub will use the default configuration.

Before merging this PR, Make sure the [Issues tab is enabled](https://whitesource.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/WD/pages/594641239/Enabling+the+Issues+Tab+for+the+GitHub+Repository). issue.title: Option to let remotes adjust MQTT itho/state
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Remotes connected to the Itho (not the add-on) don't adjust mqtt topic itho/state (probably by design).

**Expected behaviour**
Is it possible to create a option that lets remotes connected to the Itho-unit (not the add-on) adjust MQTT topic itho/state based on the given input on the remote? That way remote commands will be visible through MQTT, while maintaining all standard functionality of the RFT CO2 230V being connected to the Itho-unit.

**Device information**
- Current firmware version: 2.4.0-alpha8
- Hardware revision: 2
- CC1101 RF module enabled: yes

issue.title: Copying between diagrams
issue.body:
* [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/jgraph/drawio/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.
* [x] I have searched the issue tracker for a feature request that matches the one I want to file, without success.

**Describe the bug**
When copying a shape from a multi sheet draw.io document, and pasting into another draw.io document the shape isn't copied to the sheet being viewed. The paste operation will create empty sheet(s) to mimic the source sheet-layout and copy the shape there.

The user then need to drag the shape through the diagram, which could be over multiple sheets, to where it needs the shape to be.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a diagram with more than one sheet, say a 2 wide x 3 tall. Put any shape in the bottom right page. Copy the shape.
2. Make another diagram with one sheet. Try to paste the shape to the location you are viewing.

**Expected behavior**
The shape should be copied to the sheet being viewed, preferably place in the viewable section of that sheet.

**draw.io version (In the Help->About menu of the draw.io editor):**

- draw.io version [17.4.2]

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [macOS]

issue.title: Arrays of numbers do not appear to be processed as expected

labels.name: checks
labels.description: Check additions or changes

issue.body:
This issue description will be based off the following Terraform:
```
resource "google_compute_firewall" "should_pass_01" {
  name    = "test-firewall2"
  network = "network_name"

  allow {
    protocol = "tcp"
    ports = ["21"]
  }
}

resource "google_compute_firewall" "should_pass_02" {
  name    = "test-firewall2"
  network = "network_name"

  allow {
    protocol = "tcp"
    ports = ["21", "443"]
  }
}
```
And this policy:
```
---
metadata:
  id: 'custom_policy_id_000356'
  name: 'Firewall restricts traffic on SSH port (22)'
  guidelines: 'Do not use e2-micro instance type'
  category: 'networking'
  severity: 'critical'
scope:
  provider: 'gcp'
definition:
  cond_type: 'attribute'
  resource_types:
    - 'google_compute_firewall'
  attribute: 'allow.ports'
  operator: 'not_contains'
  value: '22'
```
**Describe the issue**
Both resources above should pass. This first is neither passed, failed, or skipped. It errors out and is silently ignored.  I debugged the code to some level and by the time the actual comparison is done in the `common/checks_infra/solvers/attribute_solvers/contains_attribute_solver.py`, the resource value of `['21']` has not only been converted to s standalone value of `'21'` but also a numeric value of `21`. The comparison for the contains/not_contains operator uses the python `in` and thus the ultimate comparison made is `'22' in 21` which throws an exception since an int isn't iterable. 

It would also be incorrect for the comparison to be `'22' in '21'` as (I think) that would iterate over the characters in the string. The correct comparison, and the one that occurs where there's more that one value in the resource array, would seem to be the one that's expected by the way the policy and resources is written; i.e. `'22' in ['21']`. 

When the comparison is made on the second resource, it works as expected: `'21' in ['21', '443']`. 

Yes, I know that there is a python check that already performs this exact port check, but I'm making the point with an example. 

**Examples**
Provided above. 

**Version (please complete the following information):**
 - Checkov Version:  2.0.1050

issue.title: [Kill Process] ...Showing irrelevant % of usage?

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: extension
labels.description: Issues related to one of the extensions in the Store

issue.body:
# Extension – [Kill Process](https://github.com/raycast/extensions/tree/161ef683e135825a8fef68699742aca55ebca9ff/extensions/kill-process/)
Author: Harun Jonuzi

<!--
Please provide a clear and concise description of what the bug is. Include
screenshots if needed. Please test using the latest version of the extension, Raycast and API.
-->
## Description

In my kill process extension from raycast you can clearly see that "syspolicyd" is showing that 75% of cpu is being used, everytime I re-run the extension it goes back and forth from 65% to 80%, it started to worry me how can it waste that much of cpu power? Then I run the Activity Monitor from macbook and saw that the "syspolicyd" is actually using 0% of cpu, so I am really concerned to which one is accurate? Or is it a buf of the Extension?

I did some research and found that this "syspolicyd" is a gateway keeper for scanning files on macbook, in the past it used to be a huge problem because it wasted alot of battery on users, but nowadays it is fixed.

That is my only concern, is the extension bugged, how accurate is this extension in showing % of the processes being used by the CPU?
-----
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97728749/190633510-d4ad6652-8a55-4791-9cf1-e08e944bf5ce.png)


## Steps To Reproduce

1. Run raycasat
2. Open Kill Process
3.  See the % Results

<!--
Your bug will get fixed much faster if the extension author can easily reproduce it. Issues without reproduction steps may be immediately closed as not actionable.
-->

## The current behavior

1. Not showing correct % of processes that are being used by the CPU?

## The expected behavior

1. It has to show the correct % of the processes that are being used by the CPU.

### Raycast version
<!-- Please find your current version of Raycast by clicking on the Raycast logo in your menu bar -->

Raycast version 1.39.3
